page.title: 06THE RIVER BREAMISH
page.content: The river Breamish is the dominant stream of the area.In the west of this area it is within ten miles of its source and is little more than a rocky, fast-flowing stream. In the far west of the area it is in a valley more than 1000 feet deep. In the east of the area the valley sides are also steep-sided.In the middle of this area the valley sides are less steep and less deep. The river is generally shallow with occasional deep pools, containing fish such as trout and salmon. In most places there is a broad stony bed with a relatively narrow stream flowing through it.The river is prone to flooding particularly during winter rains or thawing snow. The river has several tributaries such as the Linhope burn, but these are usually only small streams. There is little pollution.
